message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and medical history suggest ovarian cancer, and the elevated CA-125 is a tumor marker for ovarian cancer. The microscopic examination is most likely to show atypical epithelial cells along with psammoma bodies, which are commonly found in ovarian cancer. The other options do not correspond with the presentation or tumor markers.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the elevated CA-125 level indicate the possibility of ovarian cancer. Among the options, only option C matches the characteristic microscopic findings of ovarian cancer, including atypical epithelial cells and psammoma bodies.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated serum level of CA-125 suggests a possible ovarian cancer, and among the options, only option C describes atypical epithelial cells and psammoma bodies, which are characteristic of epithelial ovarian cancer. Large undifferentiated germ cells with clear cytoplasm are seen in dysgerminoma (also an ovarian tumor but less common), small round cells that form Call-Exner bodies are characteristic of granulosa cell tumors, and spindle-shaped stromal cells along with signet ring cells are characteristic of Krukenberg tumors (a metastatic gastric cancer to the ovary).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the adnexal mass suggest ovarian cancer, and the elevated CA-125 level supports this diagnosis. Atypical epithelial cells along with psammoma bodies are commonly seen in ovarian serous carcinoma. The other options are not commonly associated with ovarian cancer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the elevated CA-125 suggest ovarian cancer. Psammoma bodies are often seen in the histology of ovarian cancer with atypical epithelial cells. Large undifferentiated germ cells with clear cytoplasm suggest a malignant ovarian germ cell tumor, while small, round cells forming Call-Exner bodies suggest granulosa cell tumor. Spindle-shaped stromal cells along with signet ring cells suggest Krukenberg tumor, which is a metastatic ovarian tumor from gastric adenocarcinoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the elevated CA-125 suggest ovarian cancer. Among the options, only option C describes the histological features of serous carcinoma, which is the most common type of ovarian cancer. Psammoma bodies are also commonly observed in serous carcinoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and history indicate ovarian cancer, and the elevated CA-125 is a tumor marker for ovarian cancer. Atypical epithelial cells with psammoma bodies are often seen in ovarian cancer. Large undifferentiated germ cells with clear cytoplasm suggest embryonal carcinoma, which is a type of testicular cancer. Small, round cells that form Call-Exner bodies suggest granulosa cell tumors of the ovary. Spindle-shaped stromal cells with signet ring cells suggest Krukenberg tumors, which are metastatic tumors to the ovaries from a gastrointestinal primary site.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and history of endometriosis suggest an ovarian tumor, and the elevated CA-125 level suggests a malignant tumor. Option C is the most likely finding in a malignant ovarian tumor, with atypical epithelial cells and psammoma bodies. Large undifferentiated germ cells with clear cytoplasm suggest a type of testicular tumor, small, round cells that form Call-Exner bodies suggest a granulosa cell tumor, and spindle-shaped stromal cells along with signet ring cells suggest a Krukenberg tumor.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and elevated CA-125 levels suggest ovarian cancer. Among the options, only option C describes the typical findings of ovarian cancer, including atypical epithelial cells and psammoma bodies. Large undifferentiated germ cells with clear cytoplasm are typically found in testicular germ cell tumors, small, round cells that form Call-Exner bodies are seen in granulosa cell tumors, and spindle-shaped stromal cells along with signet ring cells are found in gastrointestinal stromal tumors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and history may suggest ovarian cancer. Elevated serum level of CA-125 is a marker for ovarian cancer. Among the options, atypical epithelial cells along with psammoma bodies is indicative of ovarian cancer. Large undifferentiated germ cells with clear cytoplasm is a feature of yolk sac tumors. Small, round cells that form Call-Exner bodies are a feature of granulosa cell tumors. Spindle-shaped stromal cells along with signet ring cells are a feature of Krukenberg tumors.
